thread.title: Giants linebacker Jonathan Casillas visits students at Jersey City school (PHOTOS)
thread.title_full: Giants linebacker Jonathan Casillas visits students at Jersey City school (PHOTOS)

author: Patrick Villanova | The Jersey Journal
title: Giants linebacker Jonathan Casillas visits students at Jersey City school (PHOTOS)
text:
Jonathan Casillas ' journey has taken him from the gridiron at New Brunswick High School to Division I college stadiums to the bright lights of two Super Bowls . 
On Tuesday, he returned to where it all started: Jersey City. 
The New York Giants linebacker and two-time Super Bowl champion visited Barack Obama School 34 in Jersey City and fielded questions from students on life and his career in the NFL . 
Casillas, 29, was born and raised in Jersey City but moved to New Brunswick where he attended high school and picked up football . From there, he earned a scholarship at the University of Wisconsin and was signed as an undrafted free agent by the New Orleans Saints in 2009. He helped the Saints win their first championship that season, recovering a key onside kick to start the second half against the Indianapolis Colts in Super Bowl XLIV. 
He later spent part of two seasons with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers before being traded to the New England Patriots, where he won his second Super Bowl in 2014. He signed with his hometown Giants in 2015 and ranked second on the team in tackles this past season. 
Click through the photos above for a look back on Casillas' memorable visit to Barack Obama School 34 on Tuesday. Most Read
